comments.raw_text:
Still present. To reproduce :
Create a new mail (HTML format by default for me)
Copy some cell in a spreadsheet (tested with googledoc and LibreOffiche)
Paste into the new mail

=> you get the table, it is possible to edit the table (add rows, edit cell contents) but I did not find a way to put the caret (the point where new typing goes, materialized by a blinking vertical line) before or after the table in order to enter regular text before or after the table.
My work-around is to paste the table at a point with some text before and after it. But I have to click on the extra texts to edit them. I did not find a way to move to the regular text with keyboard (without using the mouse). And I often forget to add text before beginning to compose the mail and paste the table. In this case, I have to redo all from beginning.

I add that this is globally very confusing because the caret disappear. when pasting the table.

Configuration
Thunderbird 78.13.0 64 bits on Windows 10. French (windows & thunderbird)
Same behavior in -safe-mode
comments.author: bugmoz@brion.fr
